string-array.name: rifleman_verb_about
string-array.item: Unique Type 97B assault rifle, developed on the basis of the Type 97 submachine gun
Croatian automatic machine made in the bullpup layout
Modified version of the M16 with a shortened barrel and a retractable butt
Assault rifle of the South Korean Armed Forces, developed by ST Daewoo
5.56 mm light machine gun similar in design to the FN Minimi machine gun
Standard medium machine gun, which was previously in service with the US Army, and is now used by the US Marine Corps
AS Val (Special Machine Gun) — a Soviet machine gun with a built-in silencer. Developed by TsNII Tochmash in the second half of the 1980s
The IMBEL IA2 assault rifle was officially adopted by the Brazilian army as a replacement for the obsolete FN-FAL and M16A2
Polish rifle complex (Modułowy Systema Broni Strzeleckiej-modular small arms system), made in the bull-pap layout
Light assault rifle developed for the US Army in the early 2000s
Modification of the M60E3 machine gun with the ability to change the barrel and mount optical sights
Assault rifle caliber 5. 56x45 mm, developed in the early 90s by the German company Heckler Koch
German light machine gun developed by Heckler Koch
Universal automatic rifle with a free bolt, using caliber cartridges .22 LR or 9x19 mm Parabellum
Israeli machine gun, developed on the basis of the Finnish machine gun RK 62. Mainly designed for desert combat
Israeli assault rifle caliber 5. 56x45 mm, made according to the scheme of bull-pop. The body of the weapon is made of light alloys and high-strength polymers
Light Soviet machine gun caliber 7. 62x39 mm, created by Mikhail Kalashnikov in the late 1950s in parallel with the AKM assault rifle
Manual machine gun based on the XM8 complex with a weighted barrel and a drum magazine for 100 rounds
Assault rifle for tactical operations and sports competitions. The weapon comes with a unique Jailbrake flame extinguisher and an enlarged magazine
The legendary Degtyarev machine gun, the main weapon of fire support of the Red Army infantry.

string-array.name: rifleman_kred_about
string-array.item: German single machine gun from the company "Heckler and Koch", also known as the HandK MG5.
The legendary machine gun, which allows you to fire cut-offs of two shots without recoil between them, which provides a very high accuracy of shooting.
Lightweight rifle with excellent ergonomics, developed in Germany based on the AR-15 platform.
The standard medium machine gun, which was previously in service with the US Army, and is now used by the US Marine Corps.
The Knights Armament Light Assault Machine Gun is a light machine gun system developed by Eugene Stoner and produced by the Knights Armament Company.
A German submachine gun developed during World War II.
HCAR is interesting both for snipers who want to go beyond the usual gameplay, and for stormtroopers who want to try something different from their usual machine guns.
The Degtyarev light machine gun (RPD) appeared back in 1944 and served as an infantry support weapon until the mid-sixties.
Austrian 5.56 mm assault rifle, made according to the bullpup scheme
A 5.56 mm belt-fed light machine gun manufactured by the German company Heckler Koch
Assault rifle in the bullpup layout, created by MAS
Belgian 5.56x45 mm NATO assault rifle developed by FN Herstal
A shortened version of the SIG 550, equipped with a modified sighting system
Modified version of the AUG A3 rifle with a weighted barrel, used as a light machine gun

string-array.name: rifleman_box_about
string-array.item: Sten production was launched at the beginning of the Second World War.
An improved version of the Howa Type 89 rifle in service with the Self-Defense Forces.
Light assault rifle developed by the Australian company Thales.
A shortened model of the Czech machine gun CZ 805 with a cartridge of 5.56x45 mm.
Light assault rifle manufactured by Cobalt Kinetics, the receiver of which is made of a single piece of aluminum.
A unique weapon that shoots dense clumps of energy.
A modern machine gun designed to replace the legendary AK-74 in the Russian army.
The Belgian FN FAL assault rifle, along with the Kalashnikov assault rifle and the M16, is one of the most widely used in the world
Unique AK Alpha assault rifle, developed on the basis of the Kalashnikov assault rifle,
Assault rifle developed by Beretta in 2008. It is characterized by convenient recoil, high rate of fire and high penetration ability
The famous automatic rifle developed by Mikhail Kalashnikov and adopted in the USSR in 1949
German single 7.62x51 mm NATO machine gun
Russian single 7.62×54 mm machine gun with high firepower and long range
A variant of the M16A2 rifle with a Picatinny rail mounted above the receiver, which allows the use of most military and civilian sighting devices
A variant of the M249 machine gun with a shortened barrel and a sliding butt, primarily intended for amphibious troops
British assault rifle that allows you to fire in short bursts with a cut - off of three rounds
ACR-short for Adaptive Combat Rifle (adaptive assault rifle), Developed in the United States as a replacement for the M16 assault rifle
The SCAR is an assault rifle developed by FN Herstal for the United States Special Operations Command (SOCOM)
Export version of the Chinese Type 97 rifle, designed for the 5. 56x45 mm NATO cartridge,so that the magazine receiver meets the STANAG standard.
